supportedPredicates.displayName: Group has the same Identity Domain as the Resource Identity Domain
supportedPredicates.descriptionHTML: Creates a condition for a security policy that is true when a specified group has the same identity domain as the resource identity domain.

arguments.descriptionHTML: Group Name

supportedPredicates.displayName: Group has the same Identity Domain as the specified Identity Domain
supportedPredicates.descriptionHTML: Creates a condition for a security policy that is true when a specified group has the same identity domain as the specified identity domain.

arguments.descriptionHTML: Group Name
Identity Domain

supportedPredicates.displayName: Group Identity Domain has administrative rights in calling context
supportedPredicates.descriptionHTML: Creates a condition for a security policy that is true when a specified group has the same identity domain as the resource or administrative identity domain.

arguments.descriptionHTML: Group Name

supportedPredicates.displayName: Access occurs before
supportedPredicates.descriptionHTML: Creates a condition for a security policy that is true when the policy is being evaluated before the date and time specified in the predicate. The server timezone is used but an optional timezone offset can be specified.

arguments.descriptionHTML: Date in location specific format of "y-MM-dd". E.g.: April 25, 2006 is "2006-04-25". An optional time of the form "y-MM-dd HH:mm:ss" can be added. E.g.: "2006-04-25 20:45:35".
The time ahead of GMT (enter as "GMT+h:mm") or behind GMT (enter as "GMT-h:mm"). E.g.: Eastern Standard Time in the USA would be "GMT-5:00".

supportedPredicates.displayName: Group has the same Identity Domain as the Administrative Identity Domain
supportedPredicates.descriptionHTML: Creates a condition for a security policy that is true when a specified group has the same identity domain as the administrative identity domain.

arguments.descriptionHTML: Group Name

supportedPredicates.displayName: Allow access to everyone
supportedPredicates.descriptionHTML: Creates a condition for a security policy that permits access to everyone.

supportedPredicates.displayName: Server is in development mode
supportedPredicates.descriptionHTML: Creates a condition for a security policy that is true when the server is in development mode.

supportedPredicates.displayName: User has the same Identity Domain as the Resource Identity Domain
supportedPredicates.descriptionHTML: Creates a condition for a security policy that is true when a specified user has the same identity domain as the resource identity domain.

arguments.descriptionHTML: User Name

supportedPredicates.displayName: Context element's value equals a string constant
supportedPredicates.descriptionHTML: Creates a condition for a security policy that is true when the context element's value is equal to a string constant.

arguments.descriptionHTML: Name of the Context Element which value is to be evaluated
The string value to compare against.

supportedPredicates.displayName: Access occurs between specified hours
supportedPredicates.descriptionHTML: Creates a condition for a security policy that is true when the policy is being evaluated between the start and end times specified in the predicate. The server timezone is used but an optional timezone offset can be specified.

arguments.descriptionHTML: The earliest permissible time in the format of "HH:mm:ss". E.g.: "20:45:35".
The latest permissible time in the format of "HH:mm:ss". E.g.: "20:45:35".
The time ahead of GMT (enter as "GMT+h:mm") or behind GMT (enter as "GMT-h:mm"). E.g.: Eastern Standard Time in the USA would be "GMT-5:00".

supportedPredicates.displayName: Oracle Identity Cloud Service application role
supportedPredicates.descriptionHTML: Creates a condition for a security policy that is true when a specified application role has the same role name and application name as those specified in the predicate.

arguments.displayName: Oracle Identity Cloud Service application role name
arguments.descriptionHTML: Application role name that the Oracle Identity Cloud Service application role needs to match

arguments.displayName: Oracle Identity Cloud Service application name
arguments.descriptionHTML: Application name that the Oracle Identity Cloud Service application role needs to match

supportedPredicates.displayName: Access occurs after
supportedPredicates.descriptionHTML: Creates a condition for a security policy that is true when the policy is being evaluated after the date and time specified in the predicate. The server timezone is used but an optional timezone offset can be specified.

arguments.descriptionHTML: Date in location specific format of "y-MM-dd". E.g.: April 25, 2006 is "2006-04-25". An optional time of the form "y-MM-dd HH:mm:ss" can be added. E.g.: "2006-04-25 20:45:35".
The time ahead of GMT (enter as "GMT+h:mm") or behind GMT (enter as "GMT-h:mm"). E.g.: Eastern Standard Time in the USA would be "GMT-5:00".

supportedPredicates.displayName: Context element defined
supportedPredicates.descriptionHTML: Creates a condition for a security policy that is true when 	 the specified context element attribute is defined and not null.

arguments.descriptionHTML: Name of the Context Element which value is to be evaluated

supportedPredicates.displayName: Access occurs on specified days of the week
supportedPredicates.descriptionHTML: Creates a condition for a security policy that is true when the policy is being evaluated on the specified days of the week.

arguments.descriptionHTML: The day of the week: Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday, Sunday.
The time ahead of GMT (enter as "GMT+h:mm") or behind GMT (enter as "GMT-h:mm"). E.g.: Eastern Standard Time in the USA would be "GMT-5:00".

supportedPredicates.displayName: Access occurs before the specified day of the month
supportedPredicates.descriptionHTML: Creates a condition for a security policy that is true when the policy is being evaluated on a day before the day of the month specified in the predicate. The server timezone is used but an optional timezone offset can be specified.

arguments.descriptionHTML: The ordinal number of the day within the current month with values in the range from -31 to 31. Negative values count back from the end of the month, so the last day of the month is specified as -1. 0 indicates the day before the first day of the month.
The time ahead of GMT (enter as "GMT+h:mm") or behind GMT (enter as "GMT-h:mm"). E.g.: Eastern Standard Time in the USA would be "GMT-5:00".

supportedPredicates.displayName: User has the same Identity Domain as the Administrative Identity Domain
supportedPredicates.descriptionHTML: Creates a condition for a security policy that is true when a specified user has the same identity domain as the administrative identity domain.

arguments.descriptionHTML: User Name

supportedPredicates.displayName: Access occurs on the specified day of the month
supportedPredicates.descriptionHTML: Creates a condition for a security policy that is true when the policy is being evaluated on the day of the month specified in the predicate. The server timezone is used but an optional timezone offset can be specified.

arguments.descriptionHTML: The ordinal number of the day within the current month with values in the range from -31 to 31. Negative values count back from the end of the month, so the last day of the month is specified as -1. 0 indicates the day before the first day of the month.
The time ahead of GMT (enter as "GMT+h:mm") or behind GMT (enter as "GMT-h:mm"). E.g.: Eastern Standard Time in the USA would be "GMT-5:00".

supportedPredicates.displayName: Scope
supportedPredicates.descriptionHTML: Creates a condition for a security policy that is true when a specified Scope has the same scope name and identity domain as those specified in the predicate.

arguments.descriptionHTML: The string value to compare against.
Identity Domain

supportedPredicates.displayName: Access occurs after the specified day of the month
supportedPredicates.descriptionHTML: Creates a condition for a security policy that is true when the policy is being evaluated on a day after the day of the month specified in the predicate. The server timezone is used but an optional timezone offset can be specified.

arguments.descriptionHTML: The ordinal number of the day within the current month with values in the range from -31 to 31. Negative values count back from the end of the month, so the last day of the month is specified as -1. 0 indicates the day before the first day of the month.
The time ahead of GMT (enter as "GMT+h:mm") or behind GMT (enter as "GMT-h:mm"). E.g.: Eastern Standard Time in the USA would be "GMT-5:00".

supportedPredicates.displayName: Context element's value equals a numeric constant
supportedPredicates.descriptionHTML: Creates a condition for a security policy that is true when the context element's value is equal to a numeric constant.

arguments.descriptionHTML: Name of the Context Element which value is to be evaluated
A numeric value.

supportedPredicates.displayName: Context element's value is greater than a numeric constant
supportedPredicates.descriptionHTML: Creates a condition for a security policy that is true when the context element's value is greater than a numeric constant.

supportedPredicates.descriptionHTML: Creates a condition for a security policy that denies access to everyone.

supportedPredicates.displayName: Group
supportedPredicates.descriptionHTML: Group Predicate

arguments.descriptionHTML: Add one or more groups to this condition. If you add multiple groups, the condition evaluates as true if the user is a member of ANY of the groups.

supportedPredicates.displayName: Role
supportedPredicates.descriptionHTML: Role Predicate

arguments.descriptionHTML: Add one or more roles to this condition. If you add multiple roles, the condition evaluates as true if the user is in ANY of the roles.
